labels.name: wontfix

issues.title: Questions from initial review of Introduction
issues.author: muhammad-usama-sardar
issues.body:
- I didn't find "Payload" in RFC9261. Can you refer me to the document which is closest in the sense it is used?
- I don't seem to understand the following sentence: 
> The end-entity certificate is associated with key material that serves as an Attestation Key, which acts as Evidence originating from the Attester.
- Not sure about the following sentence: Why not from the client? Are you scoping to a specific scenario, e.g., server/client as Attester or something else? This needs some explanation. 
> The mechanisms described in this document focus primarily on the server's ability to generate TLS Exported Authenticators.

pulls.title: Initial review of Introduction
pulls.author: muhammad-usama-sardar
pulls.body:
- I tend to disagree with the following sentence because the role of Verifier is the same in both models. It depends on the order of data flow. 
> These interactions can follow different models, such as the passport or background check model, depending on the role of a verifier in the system.
- The text regarding RFC 9261 in the draft was very confusing to me. Particularly, we need to distinguish between Exported Authenticator and Authenticator Request. I made some initial changes. Please check.

pulls.title: More security considerations
pulls.author: yaronf
pulls.body: This is not very polished, but there are security considerations to do with attestation at the application level.
